release.action: "Added AgentQuickStarter Class for Bean testing"
"Changed serialization of Session.java to accomodate for time differences of machines - Serialization is incompatible with older versions"
"Changed default executionInterval for agents to 1ms (from 10ms)"
"Fixed memory leak in RemoteExecutor"
"First prototype of agentRole-usage in agents."
"The SimpleAgent configuration now contains a CommunicationBean. The Configurations for SimpleAgentWithCommunication and NonBlockingAgentWithCommunication have been removed."

"Added new property agent.communication which should be used for the CommunicationBean now. CommunicationBeans in the agentbeans-List are automatically set to this property for this version, but throw a warning. This will however be changed for further releases."
"thisAgent.searchAction()" and "thisAgent.searchAllActions()" now also return own Actions.
"Session class no longer uses a source, all information about affected beans is now in the session-events."
"Added getMemory() method to Agent-class."
"Both execution cycles now correctly process Session-Timeouts and inform all sources of doActions about the cancelation."
"The NonBlockingExecutionCycle now checks if a CommunicationBean is present. If no CommunicationBean is found, usage of RemoteExecutors is disabled."
New AAMM-based configuration of default agent nodes, message brokers, agents, agent beans and other agent resources.
Default spring configurations fixed to avoid creation of zombie agent resources.
Allowed to have more than one message broker per JVM.
New management function to change the name of agent nodes.
The JMX names of all managed JIAC resources contains the unique ID instead the name of the corresponding agent node.
Renaming spring configurations of default agent nodes from "Platform" to "Node".
Removed package "de.dailab.jiactng.agentcore.comm.wp" with old implementation of distributed agent and service directory.
Agent nodes and agents use new implementation of distributed agent and service directory in package "de.dailab.jiactng.agentcore.directory" and added management interface to this implementation.
Some minor changes and fixes (performance, use copied arrays in getters and setters instead of references, infinite recursive loop, ...).
Upgrade to ActiveMQ 5.3.
Moved all operational and management interfaces of agentCore to new module agentCoreAPI. Thus, agentCore is now only the implementation of these interfaces.
New static ActiveMQ broker and network connector configuration.
New management function to get the description of an agent.
New message header field "SEND_TO".
New mobility flag within agent description to indicate mobile agents.
Added attribute change notifications for agent beans and agents.
Removed package "de.dailab.jiactng.agentcore.servicediscovery" with old servicediscovery code.
Added new management functions for getting the authorization capability of agent beans.
GetActionList() of agents collects the current entries of all agent beans.
Use new directory search for remote action invocation and to find authorization action.
Return same hash code for all actions.
Start and stop time property of agents is now configurable via Spring.
Do not start agents with an explicit start time when starting agent node.
Broker name is unique in the network by using SecureRandom instead of hashCode.
Removed classes "DoRemoteAction", "RemoteAction" and "RemoteActionResult".
Added scope of actions.
Added package "de.dailab.jiactng.agentcore.directory" with new implementation of distributed agent and service directory containing also service matcher and ontology storage.
Automatic action invocation.
ActionPerformedNotification contains also the state, result, original user, original provider and original service of the action invocation and overwrites the methods equals() and hashCode().
Revised refreshment of stored agents within service directory.
Service directory uses action template instead of action for checking action presence in memory.
ActiveMQ broker uses the new network gateway implementation.
Added depth counter to session stack in order to ensure stable handling of sessions in memory.
Added methods for remote action invocation.
Timer-based start and stop of agents using new integrated TimerMBean of agent node.
Flexible token-based authorisation for JIAC action invocations.
Creation of agents does not automatically initializes these agents.
Write session object into memory before and not after invoking doAction().
New package "de.dailab.jiactng.agentcore.execution" also with a non-blocking execution cycle to support parallel action execution and synchronous action invocation.
New management interface for agent workload measurement.
New package "de.dailab.jiactng.agentcore.management.jmx.client" with extensible management client API for easy management of local or remote JIAC TNG resources.
Added new name for logging configuration to avoid conflicts.
Remove sessions from memory also for actions without result receiver.
AbstractMethodExposingBean writes action results for "void" actions and SimpleExecutionCycle writes action results with failures in case of an exception.
Services are now reliably discovered by using the service directory if they are there, also cross-node.
New Spring property allowing to list the name of actions which should be registered automatically within the service directory.
Disable management of old items and enable management of new items when changing memory, execution cycle or list of agent beans.
SessionIds are now passed down to sub-services during service usage.
Strict mode support added to "de.dailab.jiactng.agentcore.lifecycle.DefaultLifecycleHandler".
